meanings.definition: A person or thing that squeaks.
meanings.sent1: The little mouse was one of the squeakers in the house.
meanings.sent2: The old door hinges were the squeakers in the quiet night.
meanings.sent3: The toy duck became a squeakers when squeezed, much to the delight of the children.
meanings.sent4: In the choir, the soprano singer stood out as the squeakers, hitting the highest notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The tiny puppy was the cutest squeakers in the litter, always making adorable sounds.

meanings.sent1: The loud squeakers of the rusty swing echoed through the park.
meanings.sent2: The excited child let out a squeakers of joy when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent3: The squeakers of the teapot signaled that the water was boiling hot.
meanings.sent4: The squeakers of the violin filled the concert hall with beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: The squeakers of the baby bird caught the attention of its mother in the nest.

meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a squeaking sole.
meanings.sent1: The little girl loved her new squeakers, making noise with every step.
meanings.sent2: The clown entertained the children with his squeakers as he walked around.
meanings.sent3: The squeakers of the shoes made it hard for the spy to move quietly.
meanings.sent4: The squeakers of the sneakers announced the arrival of the playful puppy.
meanings.sent5: The squeakers of the shoes added a fun element to the dance performance.
